result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony G Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond to be applied. Court costs to be paid within 60 days. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.

Defendant cannot report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances, absolute sobriety is required.
Huber for work granted.

Concurrent with: 13CF1201

Defendant Anthony G Patterson in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Anthony G Patterson in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
The State asks the Court to take judicial notice specifically referencing the bond and conditions thereof and the ZCI progress report that details the violations that are alleged in this file.  
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  
Defense asks that the Court modify bond to a signature bond with GPS. The Court notes a total of 15 violations in the months deft was monitored by ZCI. The State objects to bond modification as requested citing the violations with ZCI and the seriousness of the charges.

BTC: bond modification is denied

Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

RPD-left message for Corinne
1:07 pm

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to house arrest are court dates and attorney appointments  as well as employment at American Metals.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing on September 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.

BTC: Vacate warrant. Bond to be set at $1,500.00 cash. Conditions as previously set in prior files including GPS
